channel.title: Jagex you so fine you blow my mind
channel.description:
Song at 0:22 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UKZAA_9mQGg
Song at 0:50 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VH3fLzxRX40
lol'd hard. I knew it the second I heard it. If you deny it you're lying to yourself

item.title: Jagex you so fine you blow my mind
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

WoW copied everquest. But they completely destroyed it because everquest was a pretty terrible game.

Blizzard as usual refined the idea and polished the game further than anyone else ever would

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex you so fine you blow my mind

item.title: Jagex you so fine you blow my mind
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

The reason I compare it to WoW is yet again because I find it to be the closest formula that Jagex is following, as well as it being basically the brain child for every other MMORPG out there like it. WoW isn’t following other formulas from what I’ve seen, they’re creating them and then MMORPGs are conforming to their standards simply because they’ve managed to profit from it.

Jagex thinks that by mimicking another formula they can regain its playerbase, when instead they are actually pushing people farther away from it, hence why they created 07scape. Jagex doesn’t seem to acknowledge the fact that its their updates that are driving players away, not their base mechanics.

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex you so fine you blow my mind

Yes, I’m sure that we can all agree with that. Though, they should use their talent for uniqueness to make their game stand out.
[/quote]like a babymaking skill!
[/quote]Okay, you know what? I’m getting tired of listening to you bitch about that. I’m adding it to Creoso… But now I won’t release it![/quote]follow the concept I wrote in the mopar monthly topic

item.title: Jagex you so fine you blow my mind
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:34, topic:521491”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=640002.msg4313902#msg4313902 date=1371154325]

[quote author=Uncalled link=topic=640002.msg4313900#msg4313900 date=1371154196]

I wasn’t referring to using Constitution, I was referring to boosting the LP into the 1000’s. What the heck happened to the game only being 2-3 digits? There is no reason other than to make the game feel more like WoW and other generic MMORPG games.

What I think most of us are trying to say is that there was no need to make the changes so that RS looks like WoW, or even other games. Rather than fixing their original system, they sold out and copied the template of all the other generic games, most commonly and easily compared to WoW.

There are other games way more similar to World of Warcraft than RuneScape, yet people continue to rip on RuneScape and for what reason(s)?
[/quote]Because it used to be unique and different from other MMOs.

Other games are becoming more generic and yet, no one has ripped on them yet on here.
[/quote]Because the ones that started out unique weren’t popular, and the other ones started out as generic.[/quote]
Ah I see. But nonetheless, Jagex has some talented people for RuneScape.

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex you so fine you blow my mind

item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:28, topic:521491”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=640002.msg4313880#msg4313880 date=1371152795]
I wasn’t referring to using Constitution, I was referring to boosting the LP into the 1000’s. What the heck happened to the game only being 2-3 digits? There is no reason other than to make the game feel more like WoW and other generic MMORPG games.

What I think most of us are trying to say is that there was no need to make the changes so that RS looks like WoW, or even other games. Rather than fixing their original system, they sold out and copied the template of all the other generic games, most commonly and easily compared to WoW.
[/quote]This is just me assuming but I wouldn’t be surprised if the LP rising was in preparation of future combat updates(such as the eoc, rework of how prayers, etc work. )[/quote]
Exactly, EoC was just another step towards becoming a generic MMORPG.

item.title: Jagex you so fine you blow my mind
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:23, topic:521491”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=640002.msg4313835#msg4313835 date=1371149008]

[quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=640002.msg4313779#msg4313779 date=1371143336]

There is really no need to compare WoW to RS… It will not change a thing. It’s generic medieval war music.

Runescape is REALLY moving to become more like WoW now though. Its only a matter of time before they remove tile based movement for WASD

If you don’t think its becoming more like the wow/everquest model then you haven’t played either

THIS, 100%. People who are saying the game isn’t slowly converting into WoW are pretty uneducated when it comes to MMORPGs. They moved their graphics to mimic that of an overhead WoW, which I can’t complain too much as it was a somewhat nice graphical change, albeit the armour looking rather “toony”. They copied the hot bar with special moves. They copied music apparently. They upped the damage and health to mimic the massive amounts of damage dealt and taken. Everything is now single combat (although, yet again they screwed it up and made even the most aggressive beasts in lore passive). Just wait til they start making you pay 40 dollars to unlock the East Lands and what not.

They copied the action bar? Most fantasy MMO’s and MMORPG’s have some sort of action bar now. RuneScape, World of Warcraft, Everquest, Neverwinter, Dragon Age, Guild of Wars 2, League of Legend, Lord of the Rings Online, Eden Eternal, the list goes on and on. As for the lifepoints, again, most fantasy MMO’s and MMORPG’s have constitution as their lifepoint skill, it is not uncommon. So, pick other reasons of why they copied World of Warcraft please…
[/quote]The goblin background.
[/quote]again, several games have goblins in some sort of scene in the game. Also, RS when first created had goblins in it…[/quote]Yes, but the goblin background is similar to WoW’s orc background. Correct me if I’m wrong here.

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex you so fine you blow my mind

As for the lifepoints, again, most fantasy MMO’s and MMORPG’s have constitution as their lifepoint skill, it is not uncommon. So, pick other reasons of why they copied World of Warcraft please…
[/quote]The goblin background.[/quote]again, several games have goblins in some sort of scene in the game. Also, RS when first created had goblins in it…
